strings.Value: "Who might you recommend I meet here?"
"Do many Pitaxians worship Calistria?"
"Farewell."
[Attack] "I hate your cult. Die!"
"I myself give prayer to Calistria. Please, might I have your blessing?"
"The gods don't deserve our veneration."
"Calistria is the goddess of revenge... I'm sure many mention Irovetti in their prayers to her, and probably not with the kindest words?"
"Oh, a new face at the celebration! I'm pleased to meet you. Drey Yarnes, High Priest of {g|Calistria}Calistria{/g}, at your disposal."
"Are you enjoying the festival?"

"There are many prominent people here, as usual. My first recommendation would be Maestro {d|Annamede}Annamede{/d}. Many would give their lives to exchange words with her. She's {g|Pitax}Pitax's{/g} best singer — and the finest of its women!"

"Of course! She's been the patron goddess of {g|Pitax}Pitax{/g} since its founding. The goddess likes our joyful town — and its citizens love her in return. If ever you visit Pitax, you would surely enjoy the proud spikes of her cathedral — it's the most beautiful building in the city!"
"May the grace of the goddess always be with you!"

"The king himself, though... His exorbitant pride is irritating. {g|Calistria}Calistria{/g} dislikes those who would place themselves above the gods — and I wouldn't be surprised if she teaches him a lesson, sooner or later. That I could deal with, though. There's something else that I find harder and harder to tolerate."

"You see, the goddess patronizes bodily love... but only that given voluntarily. It is sometimes difficult for me to protect our young priests and priestesses from his... unsolicited attentions. I fear to imagine how hard it must be for our beautiful {d|Annamede}Annamede{/d}, or what {d|Atalia}Atalia Gitaren{/d} must deal with. The king is said to often mistake the {g|Academy of Grand Arts}Academy{/g} for his personal harem."
{n}The priest ceremoniously places his hand on your head.{/n} "May our {g|Calistria}lady{/g} help you, if she's so inclined!"
"Is that so? Well, I won't try to convert you. In the end, it's only you who'll suffer for your disbelief, not the gods."
{n}Octavia smiles at the cleric.{/n} "Praised be the {g|Calistria}Savored Sting{/g}!"
{n}Regongar bares his fangs in a grin.{/n} "Hail the {g|Calistria}Unquenchable Fire{/g}!"
"May our {g|Calistria}Lady's{/g} charity never leave us."
{n}Harrim mumbles,{/n} "Vanity... Futility... Vexation of spirit..."

"You are well versed in matters both spiritual and political. Of course, it is not my place to say what people pray to my {g|Calistria}Lady{/g} for... but you're right that many would wish for revenge upon him. To be honest, our temple has only benefited from his rise to power — Irovetti isn't stingy with his donations, and the celebrations he holds are beyond all praise."
